revised_title: Viviparity in Minute Eels: A Letter from James Sherwood to the Royal Society
tldr: James Sherwood's letter to the Royal Society describes his observation of minute eels in sour paste being viviparous. He discovered that these eels give birth to live young, contradicting the common belief that all animalcules are produced from minute eggs floating in the air. Sherwood's findings challenge the understanding of reproduction in these tiny creatures and raise questions about their origins.
